title: White fish and lemon risotto

ingredients.content: 6 spring onions/shallots, trimmed and cut into pieces
2 - 3 sprigs fresh flat-leaf parsley, leaves only, plus extra finely sliced to garnish
300 g white fish fillet, cut into pieces (2-3 cm)
½ lemon, zest only, no white pith and grated
1 - 2 pinches ground black pepper, to taste

preparations.content: Place spring onions/shallots, parsley, 50 g of the white fish and olive oil into mixing bowl and chop <b>4 sec/speed 6<b>.
Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and cook <b>1 min/100°C/speed 1<b>.
Add Arborio rice and verjuice and cook <b>1 min/100°C//speed 1<b>
Add vegetable stock paste and water and cook <b>13-15 min/100°C//speed 1<b>
Add remaining white fish, lemon zest, sea salt and pepper and combine <b>2 min//speed 1<b>.

Transfer risotto into a thermal serving bowl or other large bowl. Add butter (optional) to thermal serving bowl or other large bowl, then stir to combine with spatula. Allow the risotto to rest for 5 minutes, garnish with extra finely sliced parsley and serve.

hintsAndTricks: <b>Recipe for one:<b> reduce all ingredients by half and proceed as per recipe.
Please refer to The Basic Cookbook or the Everyday Cookbook for the Vegetable stock paste recipe.
Verjuice is made using unfermented white grapes and provides a more subtle acidic hint to dishes than using lemon juice or vinegar.
You can substitute verjuice for dry white wine.
White fish and lemon are another classic flavour combination. Enjoy this risotto with a chilled glass of white wine to complement all of the flavours.
Ensure you use good quality, very fresh fish in this recipe.
Omit the optional butter to make this recipe dairy free.
Leftover risotto can be used to make Arancini balls. Search "Arancini" on the Recipe Community home page (recipecommunity.com.au).
